items.title: Efficient implementation of multicontrolled quantum gates
items.summary: If-then-else statements are at the heart of computer programming. This study shows that MC gates can be implemented at linear cost, even for the most restricted qubit connectivity. Unlike previous approaches with quadratic cost just to swap qubits and bring them next to each other, the methods here avoid extra cost by implementing arbitrary MC gates without such swaps.
